com.joliciel.talismane.parser

Class ParseTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joliciel.talismane.parser.ParseTree

  • public class ParseTree
extends java.lang.Object
    A parse tree, giving a tree representation of a syntactic analysis, rooted at the artificial root.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParseTree(ParseConfiguration parseConfiguration, boolean projective)
      Same as ParseTree(ParseConfiguration, boolean, boolean) but defaults attachOrphansToRoot to false.
      ParseTree(ParseConfiguration parseConfiguration, boolean projective, boolean attachOrphansToRoot)
      Create a parse tree out of a given parse configuration.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<PosTaggedToken> getDependents(PosTaggedToken token)
      Return all of the dependents of a given pos-tagged token.
      <any> getEdgeDegree()
      Non-projectivity: returns the node with the maximum edge count in this sub-tree, where edge count is defined in ParseTreeNode.getEdgeCount().
      <any> getGapDegree()
      Non-projectivity: returns the node with the maximum gap count in this tree, where gap count is defined in ParseTreeNode.getGapCount().
      DependencyArc getGoverningArc(PosTaggedToken token)
      Get the dependency arc governing a given pos-tagged token.
      java.util.List<<any>> getIllNestedNodes()
      A list of ill-nested node pairs, see isWellNested().
      ParseTreeNode getNode(PosTaggedToken token)
      Retrieve the node corresponding to a given pos-tagged token.
      java.util.List<DependencyArc> getNonProjectiveEdges()
      Return all non-projective edges in this tree, where a non-projective edge is one where node i governs node j, and there is some node k where i<k<j such that node i does not dominate node k.
      java.util.List<ParseTreeNode> getNonProjectiveNodes()
      Return all non-projective nodes in this tree.
      java.util.List<PosTaggedToken> getPosTaggedTokens()
      The sequence of pos-tagged tokens contained in this tree, preceded by an artificial root.
      ParseTreeNode getRoot()
      This parse tree's root.
      boolean isProjective()
      Non-projectivity: are all nodes in this tree projective?
      boolean isWellNested()
      Non-projectivity: is this tree well nested?
      Two sub-trees are called disjoint if neither of their heads dominates the other.
      They interleave if there exist leaves l1, r1 ∈ T1 and l2, r2 ∈ T2, such that l1 < l2 < r1 < r2.
      A tree is well nested if none of its disjoint subtrees interleave.
      java.lang.String toString()

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParseTree

        public ParseTree(ParseConfiguration parseConfiguration,
                 boolean projective)
        Same as ParseTree(ParseConfiguration, boolean, boolean) but defaults attachOrphansToRoot to false.

      • ParseTree

        public ParseTree(ParseConfiguration parseConfiguration,
                 boolean projective,
                 boolean attachOrphansToRoot)
        Create a parse tree out of a given parse configuration.
        Parameters:
        parseConfiguration - the base configuration
        projective - whether we should use the projective arcs (true) or the potentially non-projective arcs (false)
        attachOrphansToRoot - if true, any unattached nodes are attached to the root, if false, they are left unattached

        public <any> getGapDegree()
        Non-projectivity: returns the node with the maximum gap count in this tree, where gap count is defined in ParseTreeNode.getGapCount().

      • getEdgeDegree

        public <any> getEdgeDegree()
        Non-projectivity: returns the node with the maximum edge count in this sub-tree, where edge count is defined in ParseTreeNode.getEdgeCount().

      • isProjective

        public boolean isProjective()
        Non-projectivity: are all nodes in this tree projective?
        Returns:

      • isWellNested

        public boolean isWellNested()
        Non-projectivity: is this tree well nested?
        Two sub-trees are called disjoint if neither of their heads dominates the other.
        They interleave if there exist leaves l1, r1 ∈ T1 and l2, r2 ∈ T2, such that l1 < l2 < r1 < r2.
        A tree is well nested if none of its disjoint subtrees interleave.

      • getIllNestedNodes

        public java.util.List<<any>> getIllNestedNodes()
        A list of ill-nested node pairs, see isWellNested().

      • getNonProjectiveNodes

        public java.util.List<ParseTreeNode> getNonProjectiveNodes()
        Return all non-projective nodes in this tree.

      • getNonProjectiveEdges

        public java.util.List<DependencyArc> getNonProjectiveEdges()
        Return all non-projective edges in this tree, where a non-projective edge is one where node i governs node j, and there is some node k where i<k<j such that node i does not dominate node k.
